title.narrative: Sea Cucumber Production and Management Systems

description.narrative: Harvest of sea cucumbers, a highly valued commodity consumed as food or medicine in China and elsewhere in Asia, has for many years supported livelihoods in coastal communities throughout the Asia/Pacific region. Now overharvesting has led to widespread and precipitous depletion of wild resources. Ongoing efforts to develop simple low-technology approaches to culturing sandfish (Holothuria scabra), a high-value tropical sea cucumber species, have a broad range of potential benefits in restoring coastal livelihoods and ecological function. The aim of this project is to develop commercial-scale hatchery and grow-out technologies for sandfish, recognising the critical nature of adapting systems to social, institutional and bio-physical settings in participating communities.
